citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
IACUC approved protocols #230902 and #240301 involve live trapping of animals (including Tomahawk Live Trap). Live
trapping procedures can be potentially distressing to the animals. The protocol does not contain a written narrative of the
methods and sources used to determine that alternatives to potentially distressful procedures, including live trapping,
were not available.
The IACUC shall determine that the principal investigator has considered alternatives to procedures that may cause more
than momentary or slight pain or distress to the animals and has provided a written narrative description of the methods
and sources used to determine that alternatives were not available.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.31(d)(1)(ii) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
IACUC approved protocols #230902 and #240301 involve live trapping of animals (including Tomahawk Live Trap). Live 
trapping procedures can be potentially distressing to the animals. The protocol does not contain a written narrative of the 
methods and sources used to determine that alternatives to potentially distressful procedures, including live trapping, 
were not available. 
The IACUC shall determine that the principal investigator has considered alternatives to procedures that may cause more 
than momentary or slight pain or distress to the animals and has provided a written narrative description of the methods 
and sources used to determine that alternatives were not available. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives. 
 
 n
